intro: Tithymalus schizoceras, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often found in grassy habitats and woodland edges. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
